message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.MS, cs.NE 

The paper deals with a deep learning approach for the reconstruction of quantitative susceptibility maps (QSM) from magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) data. This involves solving an ill-posed inverse problem, which is a common challenge in image processing and computer vision. The proposed method uses a non-locally encoder-decoder gated convolutional neural network, which is a state-of-the-art architecture for image reconstruction tasks. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). 

The paper also involves some mathematical and statistical aspects, such as the field-to-susceptibility transformation and the evaluation of quantitative metrics. Therefore, it could also be relevant to cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.MS (Mathematical Software). 

Moreover, the paper focuses on the optimization of the deep learning model, which involves hyperparameter tuning, regularization, and optimization algorithms. Therefore, it could also be relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
